I would walk: If all bicycles disappeared, I would rely on my own two feet to get around. I could walk to work, run errands, and explore new places.
I would use public transportation: If bicycles were no longer an option, I would look to public transportation such as buses, trains, and subways to get around.
I would ride: If bicycles were no longer an option, I would look to other alternatives such as scooters, mopeds, or even rollerblades to get around.
I would carpool: If bicycles were no longer an option, I would look to carpooling with friends or colleagues to get around.

I would explore alternative modes of transportation: If bicycles were no longer an option, I would look to alternative modes of transportation such as boats, horses, or even walking dogs to get around.
